issue.title: Define rangeBand in context of rangePoints.

repository.name: d3
repository.description: Bring data to life with SVG, Canvas and HTML. :bar_chart::chart_with_upwards_trend::tada:

issue.body: Previously, the rangeBand was zero when rangePoints was used. Now it returns the size of the step between points. Fixes #584.

body:
Overloading the meaning of rangeBand broke the behavior of the axis component, which depends on the rangeBand to offset the tick labels. In the case of rangeBands, tick labels are offset by half the rangeBand from the value returned by the scale, as the scale returns the lower edge of the band; however in the case of rangePoints, tick labels are not offset, being positioned exactly at the value returned by the scale, and thus rangeBand must return zero.

I will document this in the API reference to avoid ambiguity. It’d be possible to add another method, say rangeStep, which returns the distance between points when using rangePoints.

> It’d be possible to add another method, say rangeStep

Can we have this please? It does feel like it's a missing piece of functionality (imo)

issue.title: Missing `rangeRoundPoints`?

repository.name: d3
repository.description: Bring data to life with SVG, Canvas and HTML. :bar_chart::chart_with_upwards_trend::tada:

issue.body:
If there is `rangeBands` and `rangeRoundBands`, shouldn't there be a `rangeRoundPoints`?

Use case: I'm drawing a line chart using `ordinal.rangePoints` and want to draw vertical background tick lines using the same ordinal scale, and they should not be antialiased. Right now there seems to be no other way of doing this than doing "manual" rounding on the scale's output.

body: +1 for rangeStep.  I too feel like it's important to make this information available to the user.  Because of the way padding is used to calculate the space between bands, rangeBand is not sufficient to calculate everything one might want to know about the scale.  You have to know the value of step as well.  I'm building some more complex scales with D3 and would like to be able to leverage the existing scales instead of rolling my own.  But I can't do this without step.

issue.title: New ordinal scales.

repository.name: d3-scale
repository.description: Encodings that map abstract data to visual representation.

issue.body:
TODO:
- [x] ordinal
- [x] _ordinal_.unknown (fixes #13, supersedes #24)
- [x] band
- [x] ~~_band_.padding should be in pixels (range units), not a ratio?~~ no
- [x] _band_.align (fixes #16, mbostock/d3#1913)
- [x] point
- [x] _point_.step (fixes mbostock/d3#584)
- [x] ~~_point_.padding should be in pixels (range units), not a ratio?~~ no
- [x] _point_.align (fixes #16, mbostock/d3#1913)
- [x] _point_.padding is now doubled

body: I’m redesigning the ordinal scales for 4.0, and I’m happy to report that the new point scale (which replaces ordinal.rangePoints) has a _point_.step method which is equivalent to the proposed rangeStep.
